404.title: Page Not Found

steps.0: To configure your Senti device, please enter a title and an informative description.
steps.1: To configure your Senti device you need to allow Senti to store the location of the device. Accept this when prompted to allow this from your mobile device. Secondly type in the actual physical address where the device is located, and select a location type to further pinpoint where your data is being collected.
steps.2: To get the best data collection accuracy, you need to do a manual calibration. Select the calibration method below, that suits your puspose. Start your manual count by pressing “OPEN COUNTER” and press “START“. Push the center button to count.
steps.3: You can store optional images of your device installation. This will enhance the Senti experience, and serve as a help for Senti service technicians in case your device needs on-site service.

texts.successMessage: Your Senti device is now configured and calibrated and will produce better results when collecting data. To further enhance the accuracy of your data collection, return to the site of installation and do a new calibration on a regular basis.

helper.availableDevicesForOrg: Available devices for the selected Organisation

p.1: Senti respects the privacy of our users and is committed to protecting all forms of personal information that users have sent to Senti.
p.2: By accessing, browsing and/or using Senti, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agree to be subject to the terms and conditions of this cookie policy and therefore agree to use cookies in accordance with these terms.
p.3: In general, our users can visit Senti without telling us who they are and without disclosing any kind of personal information. Senti uses cookies to ensure the best user experience. Cookies are small text files that are located in the user's browser to track usage traces and store preferences. Our cookies do not contain information that can identify people.
p.4: Cookies can be either ”persistent” cookies or ”session” cookies: A persistent cookie is stored by a browser and is valid until its set expiration date if it is not deleted by the user before the expiration date. However, a session cookie expires at the end of a user visit when the browser is closed. We use both session and persistent cookies at Senti.
p.5: We also use Google Analytics to analyze the use of Senti. Our analytics service provider generates statistics and other website usage information through cookies. The cookies for web analytics that we use at Senti have the following names: _ga, _gat, _gid.
p.6: The information generated in relation to Senti is used to create reports on the use of Senti.
p.7: Our Analytics Services Privacy Policy Provider is available at:
p.8: Users can manage and/or delete cookies - for more information, please see
p.9: Blocking or deleting all cookies has a negative influence on the stability of many websites. If users choose to block our cookies, they are not able to use all of the website's properties.
p.10: The policy may be updated from time to time, e.g. due to modifications of relevant legislation or changes in our corporate structure. We encourage all our users to periodically re-read this page for the latest information on our data protection practices.

cardContent.alerts:
Did you know that? … 
 Get true intelligent rule-based alerts about the nature of the data you are collecting.
cardContent.api: SentiAPI allows you to build your own IoT Dashboards, Apps or Widgets. SentiAPI support access to your own Senti IoT device data or paid access to Senti Big Data based upon the crowd-sourced anonymised pool of Senti data.
cardContent.data: Get detailed lists and charts to measure and analyse your collected data. Create reports and export data in few easy steps.
cardContent.devices: Devices are the actual IoT hardware device deployed into your environment. Here you can configure and control the IoT devices used in your data collections.
cardContent.notifications: See and manage notification messages and control how, when and where you want to engage your users with notifications.
cardContent.onSiteSetup: When you deploy your IoT devices on-site, a simple configuration is advantageous. Store device name, description, location information and calibrate the device for optimal accuracy.
cardContent.projects: Projects help you manage Senti IoT data collections for specific measuring tasks and use cases. A project is a container for your data collections and data across one or more locations.
cardContent.settings: The main control center for managing settings for Senti IoT devices and your Senti App.
cardContent.users: Authenticate and manage accounts for users and organisations, and allow access to projects, collected data, devices and API’s.

dashboard.subtitle: Senti lets you control and manage all your Senti-in-a-Box Devices.

privacy.b0: You can withdraw your consent at any time.
privacy.b5: Our role as a data processor
privacy.p0: We collect personal information about you and your employees in order to fulfill our agreement with you.
privacy.p1: You cannot use Senti if you do not provide us with the minimum information we ask for.
privacy.p10: The treatment basis for the collection of personal data through our studies is your consent.
privacy.p11: If you withdraw your consent, we will delete the information that we have collected as a result of your participation in our studies.
privacy.p12: We only use your email address for marketing if we have received your explicit and prior consent.
privacy.p13: We use your personal information to conduct our customer relationships with you or your company.
privacy.p14: We also use them to improve our services and to target our messages to you and your business, including targeting advertising and content for you or your business.
privacy.p15: Your personal information is not disclosed to any third party unless you have expressly and personally consented to it.
privacy.p16: We use the subcontractors/sub-processors that appear at
privacy.p17: If you want access to the information registered about you at Senti, please contact us at privacy@senti.io.
privacy.p18: If incorrect information has been registered about you that you cannot correct yourself, or if you have other objections to our processing of your personal information, please write to us at privacy@senti.io.
privacy.p19: You have the opportunity to gain insight into which information is registered about you and you are entitled to object to our processing of your personal data.
privacy.p2: We collect your company/organisation name, address, email, telephone number and CVR number. We also collect payment information (possibly EAN number) if your company uses a paid version of Senti.
privacy.p20: If it turns out that personal information about you is incorrect or misleading, then you have the right to have them corrected.
privacy.p21: You may object at any time, that information about you is being processed. Just write to us at privacy@senti.io.
privacy.p22: You can also revoke your consent at any time for the data processing we make with your consent.
privacy.p23: You have the opportunity to complain about our processing of your personal data if we do not give you the right to your objections. The complaint must be sent to the Danish Data Inspectorate. See more at
privacy.p24: Personal data is permanently deleted or anonymized as the purpose for which they were collected is terminated.
privacy.p25: We store your personal information as long as we have an active customer relationship with you or your company.
privacy.p26: Once the customer relationship has ceased, we store your personal information as long as we are obliged to do so by law, including the accounting legislation.
privacy.p27: Your access to data from Senti is regulated in our terms and conditions, which you find here.
privacy.p28: In relation to you and your company, we are the data processor for the personal information you process and are responsible for, including storing in Senti. You will find our data processing agreement here.
privacy.p29: In case of significant changes to this privacy policy, we will notify you in the form of a notification either in Senti or at our website.
privacy.p3: We collect your name, email address, and phone number.
privacy.p4: We only collect the personal information that you provide us by creating your account with us.
privacy.p5: We also collect the personal information you provide us about your employees who must have access to Senti. We only do this to enable your company to use Senti.
privacy.p6: We do not collect personal information about you as a person from a third party. However, we collect information through our cookies. Read more about this in our cookie policy, which you will find here
privacy.p7: The personal information we collect through our use of cookies, are to pursue our legitimate interest in marketing Senti to you, in order to customize our content of Senti specifically for you and to optimize the functionality of Senti. Cloud.
privacy.p8: If you participate in the questionnaires and studies we conduct, we collect the information included in the study, including, gender, age, interests, attitudes and knowledge of various topics relevant to improving the functionality of Senti. Participation in studies is always voluntary.
privacy.p9: We use the studies to improve our services, but also to offer you and your company other services, including better targeting our services to you and your company.
privacy.subtitle: What personal information we collect for the purpose of fulfilling our agreement with you in regards to your private or business/organisation's use of Senti.
privacy.title: Senti Privacy Policy
